item.title: Ignited Minds - A Book Summary
item.description: Problems in modern Indiaâ€‹ India has unlimited potential in terms of resources, education, business, energy.â€‹ Yet we are in Self-destruction mode due toâ€‹ Faltering economyâ€‹ Rampaging povertyâ€‹ Dependence on foreign nationsâ€‹ Disharmony among diverse groups Key Takeawaysâ€‹ Youth rise to the occasion - learn, innovate and push the boundariesâ€‹ Wholesome education.â€‹ Scientific temper and a spirit of enquiryâ€‹ Change in attitude( of limited achievement) and aptitude â€‹ Grab the opportunity or create the opportunityâ€‹ Patriotism beyond Politics and Religionâ€‹ Investments in Nuclear resourcesâ€‹

item.title: Using Logback to manage Application Logs
item.description: Log Rolling/Rotation Time Based Max History Size and Time Based Max Size Capacity logging policy Acheiving based on time and size - with date+incremental index each file should be at most 20 MB, keep 30 days of history but at most 1GB References https://logback.qos.ch/access.html https://dennis-xlc.gitbooks.io/the-logback-manual/content/en/chapter-4-appenders/logback-core/rollingfileappender/size-and-time-based-rolling-policy.html

item.title: My Competitive Coding Setup
item.description: Sublime Text Editor Sublime Text Sublime Text Sublime Input Plugin Sublime Snippet Visuals https://cfviz.netlify.app/ CFAnalytics Extension Shell Utilities # Prepare practice set from solved questions find . -type f -name "*.cpp" | shuf -n 5 # Revise topic from notes find . -type f -name "*.md" | shuf -n 1

item.title: About
item.description: Hi there ðŸ‘‹ Hi! I am Dhanya Abhirami, currently working as a Senior Software Engineer at Visa and an alumnus of Vellore Institute of Technology, Vellore, India graduated with B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering in 2020. I constantly look for patterns in everything I observe. Outside of technology I love traveling on less-traveled roads. I am always on hunt for great landscapes, sunrises and sunsets. Favorite Quote : Difficult tasks must be given to lazy people because they find easier way of doing them.

item.title: Now
item.description: Updates about what I’m up to lately.1 Learning German. Learning to solve Rubik’s Cube. Trying my hand at fingerstyle Ukulele. Developing culinary skills. Sweating out on runs. Derek Siver’s movement for creating a “now” page ↩︎
